lesson_learned.headline: Going mode 2 with Mendix
lesson_learned.summary: This year our company has started experimenting with Gartner Mode 2. With Mendix we did not only get a great development suite. But also great support to get our company ready to execute business value. For me it was the first time a company brings a customer success manager. Great experience. Seven months later we got exciting product owners with apps. We already started making reusable widgets, UI/UX reuse over all apps and a developers community is being formed.
lesson_learned.liked_most: The product release rate. New improved functionality keeps on coming.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Everything seems to be possible. So be aware there still is a benefit for just buying some great custom of the shelf software.
lesson_learned.advice:
Be aware this is not just an app platform. It is a way of getting things done. Start with a small exiting team. Make small apps with high value. Then slowly take it to the next level. 
Visit other customers to learn from each other.

additional_context.deployment_scale: Specific divisions, regions, or business units

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: The overall experience with Mendix as tool and vendor is great
lesson_learned.summary:
The customer is the central point in the Mendix way of working. The response times on request are above expectations, the customer succes manager is helping you with problems, solutions and is really thinking from the customer point of view in stead of a selling point of view.
The platform roadmap is clear and everytime there are exciting new things besides the things you expect.
Even contract negotation was a joint effert without any hidden agenda's.
lesson_learned.liked_most: After an online course you're able to build your own simple apps. Mendix has build a new abstraction layer on the complexity of development and operations.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: It isn't really disliking but the ease of use can lead to less reuse of business functionality. A good architecture governence needs to be in place.
lesson_learned.advice: It isn't only bying atool but also the introduction of the agile way of working. Make sure that people are trained and the roles and rersponsibilities are clear. Hire an expirienced scrum master to lead the first developmetns.

integration_deployment.implementation_strategy: Worked with both the vendor and 3rd-party service providers

additional_context.deployment_scale: Specific divisions, regions, or business units

lesson_learned.headline: A low-code development platform that is focussed on delivering business value
lesson_learned.summary:
I was first introduced to Mendix in 2009 and have been working fulltime on Mendix projects since 2015. Since the introduction, the platform it has seen an incredible growth in functionality and maturity. My clients especially love the speed of development and the great deployment platform.
Mendix has a great developer network and a great app store. You'll get a quick response to your questions and a lot of modules and widgets are available as building blocks. This ensures the speed of development.
It comes with requirement gathering tools out of the box which is suitable for smaller organizations. Larger organizations generally rely on their own tools to gather requirements (IE Jira).
lesson_learned.liked_most: The ease of development and the availability of building blocks in the app store.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Sometimes a Mendix modeler version is released too quickly. It would be great you could always use the latest version of the modeler available without having to worry for bugs.
lesson_learned.advice: Try out the platform. A free tier is available as well as a free academy to get you started. Then you'll be able to see for yourself what the platform can bring for your organization.

additional_context.deployment_scale: Specific divisions, regions, or business units

lesson_learned.headline: Daunting at first but we had a great experience creating our What Matters Most application
lesson_learned.summary:
I have found Mendix to be very professional and great to work with. They have been patient, supportive and very knowledgeable in helping us create our first Mendix application. The online training, user guides and Forum has been brilliant to use and the knowledge within the team continues to grow. 
Where we did experience issues Nick and his team were quick to help and stayed in contact until the issue was resolved.
lesson_learned.liked_most: Once you understand the logic of the application it is quite easy to use. I do not have any coding skills at all, I do understand the basics of java, but that's all. By using the training videos and the support of Sebastiaan we managed to build, test and deploy an app within 4-5 weeks. For me the Forum and community is a fantastic tool to help find new ideas and solutions to issues I have come across during the build.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Being honest I have not found anything I dont like about the service or App...
lesson_learned.advice:
Take your time, go thorough the videos and guides, and go through them again. Never stop learning. Use the forum as there is so much knowledge and experience there.  
Make sure you have an agreed scope of what you are building as it is so easy to go of track and build something exciting, which may not be needed by the business or user....

additional_context.deployment_scale: Specific divisions, regions, or business units

lesson_learned.headline: Puts the fun back into Application Development
lesson_learned.summary: I think the product is first rate. Very easy to create good looking, usable, mobile applications for our business. The support from Mendix in getting us up and running has also been excellent - very attentive.
lesson_learned.liked_most: The output. The bootstrap front end delivers a very professional looking interface for the customer with minimal effort.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: The on-line help could be better for complete novices. There are lots of answers to questions but many of them assume you already know what you are doing and more step by step guides would be nice.
lesson_learned.advice: The domain model is everything. You need to get your entity design correct - everything else then falls into place

additional_context.deployment_scale: Specific divisions, regions, or business units

lesson_learned.headline: Easy implementation, benchmark training and great community
lesson_learned.summary: As a Business Consulting Manager I always like to integrate deep dives into our solutions during my daily tasks. When we acquired Mendix I took a few hours to learn the basics. In record time I was able to build my first apps, connect to other applications and more. I am very enthusiastic to add Mendix to my technical and storytelling repertoire.
lesson_learned.liked_most: acccesibility, training material quality, community, nearly no bug fixing required, having a coding entry point for young people
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Have not found a thing so far.
lesson_learned.advice: Try it yourself! You will have a new software up and running afterward.

additional_context.deployment_scale: Specific divisions, regions, or business units

lesson_learned.headline: Easy to start, good support. Low code development.
lesson_learned.summary:
You're up and running within minutes. If you have some experience in application development you can build your app in a day!
I like the active developer community. There is an online forum and app store.
New versions of the product are being released every month, therefore the platform continues to be improved.
lesson_learned.liked_most: With some development experience, you're creating apps in no time!
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Difficult to manage custom Java libraries
lesson_learned.advice: Start small and go to the online developers community for help and more information

integration_deployment.implementation_strategy: Worked with both the vendor and 3rd-party service providers

additional_context.deployment_scale: Specific divisions, regions, or business units

lesson_learned.headline: Great that it's foundation is rooted on Information Engineering...
lesson_learned.summary:
If you are a fan of Information Engineering back in the days of Clive Finkelstein and James Martin like me, then you'd really appreciate working with Mendix.  Not only does it speed up application development, but it also gives your application a sound data and process model using principles of Information Engineering.

I've heard so much about Agile, I've tried implementing it using tools like Trello and the like, but those tools doesn't "force" you to adhere to the practice so you and your team end up missing the essence of Agile.  But with Mendix' Team Server, everything it knit together so that your workflow is guided by and "governed" by Agile principles.

Only thing I don't like about it is the old Windows UI.  How I wish they'd port the Desktop Modeller to OS X.
lesson_learned.liked_most: Modelling is rooted from Information Engineering principles.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: The Desktop Modeller doesn't run on OSX.
lesson_learned.advice: With a good business analyst, you'd probably spend less in automating your business processes.

additional_context.deployment_scale: Team/ Individual

lesson_learned.headline: Rapid deployment and get results fast.
lesson_learned.summary: The product is at the heart of our digital delivery and has accelerated our speed to market for new channels.  The sales process felt good, but there were occasions when there could have been greater transparency in TCO.  The overall job market is not saturated with experienced developers, however, it is an easy transition from traditional programming techniques.
lesson_learned.liked_most: Ease of integration.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Access to skilled resources.
lesson_learned.advice: For heavily integrated environments ensure you have a mature 'integration layer' with API's to take full advantage of the toolset.  If not you can only enhance/extend existing ERP's at the speed of your API development.  Not an issue, but need to be aware.

additional_context.deployment_scale: Specific divisions, regions, or business units

lesson_learned.headline: Full partnership approach ensured business benefits were delivered in a matter of weeks!
lesson_learned.summary:
Knowledge from the organisation into their product capability is second to none!
The biggest benefit from the provider is their clear understanding of our scope and partnership approach to meeting the intended business benefits
lesson_learned.liked_most: The ability to build and test solutions rapidly allows the end user to find ways to keep constantly improve and adapt the solutions to meet their specific requirements
lesson_learned.disliked_most: There is still a need for technical expertise to meet the requirements
lesson_learned.advice: Define, Define, Define your requirements. Do not go in saying you need an "App" without a clear direction as to what you want to achieve. Only then does this become rapid. Building the app took weeks Define the requirement takes months!

additional_context.deployment_scale: Team/ Individual

lesson_learned.headline: Create applications faster
lesson_learned.summary: The high productivity of Mendix aPaaS provides a comprehensive and integrated set of tools and services to support companies throughout the life cycle of the application, from ideation and development to implementation and operation.
lesson_learned.liked_most:
providing a shared development collaborative tool among developers, business analysts and end users.

Of the things we like most about Mendix are the following:

Integrated environment that covers the entire life cycle of the application
Rapid visual development with user feedback capture
Use of standards to call our digital platform services
Development and maintenance of the Apps understandable by users and analysts
Facilitates the use of agile development methodologies
Access to pre-configured components and to a community of developers
Development of Apps for Desktop, Tablet and Mobile in a single environment
lesson_learned.disliked_most: At first it looked a bit frightening after they started interacting and getting to know the client's business, things flowed better.
lesson_learned.advice: In this world of change and everything points to innovation, to the unimaginable, companies like this help you plazmar all those ideas that at some point could be seen as exaggerated, consult your client portfolio and then decide on the best in terms of functionality and cost we refer to.

additional_context.deployment_scale: Company-wide

lesson_learned.headline: Excellent low code application
lesson_learned.summary:
Working with the Mendix platform has allowed us to create brilliant application that can be used in almost any part of the company. The beauty of Mendix is that you can do both Design and Development without needing extensive knowledge of coding, this means the development takes considerably less time and uses less resource. The AGILE working method used is simple to follow and allows you to easily structure the development of your application. 
Along with a great platform they have an extensive community which is on hand to help, as well as great reference documentation that allows you to easily read information about a certain feature.
lesson_learned.liked_most: The platform itself; layed out in a way that is easy to use and customisation options that allow you to tailor the working environment exactly how you need.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: I have not yet find anything I dislike, sometimes it proved difficult to set something up, but it doesn't take long to research it or ask on the forums.
lesson_learned.advice: Take the time to define the requirements for your application and lay them out in the stories. Also take the time so learn how to build the application, using the Mendix Academy and forums. I found the best way was to learn by doing.

additional_context.deployment_scale: Departmental

lesson_learned.headline: Speed, reliability and delivery
lesson_learned.summary:
The Mendix team provides an incredible level of support and engagement.
They are always willing to go the extra mile to complement the excellent platform functionality.
lesson_learned.liked_most:
Mendix is easy to learn, even for non-developers. It allows business to interact and collaborate during the development process.
Requirements easily become reality.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: The licensing model can be a bit troublesome when fully integrated in a SSO or domain environment.
lesson_learned.advice: The fast delivery can reduce the usage of the platform to quick tactical solutions, however this product is capable of delivering much more, so a careful plan and future prospects is necessary to fully realize the potential.

additional_context.deployment_scale: Specific divisions, regions, or business units

lesson_learned.headline: Product is great but finding reasonably priced service partners is not easy.
lesson_learned.summary: Have focus on customers and they do try to help. Sometimes, it is not easy to trust them as advisor as they lack the broad industry experience.
lesson_learned.liked_most: Easy to develop and deploy solutions.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Skills you need for development are still hard to find.
lesson_learned.advice: If you are expecting complexity of the application to grow, be sure to check if it Mendix can still be the right solution. Check out other products, see they fit in your landscape better. This space is becoming crowded.

lesson_learned.headline: Provides a good understanding of rapid app development and handout tools to create them
lesson_learned.summary:
Mendix provides a suitable platform for users who don't have a lot of experience coding of developing applications. Within our organization the cloud platform provides a steady stream of releases within a normally sluggish change process.

Overall i'm very satisfied about the application in my day to day work
lesson_learned.liked_most: The way the application lets you buil pre set pages, and gives you an overall understanding of creating a application
lesson_learned.disliked_most: The way it is presented to the outside world. Not everyone is capable of creating an out of the box app. This will take some time to do it properly
lesson_learned.advice: See comment above. take your time and follow the free courses

additional_context.deployment_scale: Departmental

lesson_learned.headline: Mendix is a great Low Code development platform
lesson_learned.summary: Mendix is a great platform for Low Code development.  Some of the challenges were from early adoption of the software and pushing the limits on design.
lesson_learned.liked_most: Good product with a large community support group.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: There are a bunch of release versions/updates.  There were times where the releases broke previous working functionality.
lesson_learned.advice: Take the online tutorials.  Use the Mendix Community for Support.

additional_context.deployment_scale: Company-wide

lesson_learned.headline: Great rapid development platform, enabling digital transformation and greater agility
lesson_learned.summary:
+Easy to pickup and learn +Easily extended with a small amount of Java effort +Great ability to integrate with external systems
-App portability to new versions can be tricky
lesson_learned.liked_most: Able to iterate very quickly on projects from idea to production. Visual modeling makes development FAST!
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Reliance on some appstore modules/widgets for important features (i.e. email). Changing versions can leave your modules/widgets in an incompatible state
lesson_learned.advice: Plan your sprints carefully. Failing to properly implement Agile methodology could mean big delays in Sprint completion as you realize you have to do hours of more work because you missed a key piece of business functionality

additional_context.deployment_scale: Specific divisions, regions, or business units

lesson_learned.headline: Great platform, especially for less experienced developers
lesson_learned.summary: Mendix is such a great and simple platform to use. It's lacking in certain areas (such as creating documents) but all in all is a fabulous platform, especially for people who have less experience in digital development.
lesson_learned.liked_most: So simple to use, very quick.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: I can't really fault it.

lesson_learned.headline: Nice software
lesson_learned.liked_most: Easy and fast development.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: nothing yet
lesson_learned.advice: Invest time in creating a good domain model.

lesson_learned.headline: Excited to get started with all my App ideas
lesson_learned.summary: This platform has been interesting so far.  It is igniting my sense of possibilities.  I cant wait to dive in and take fully advantage of all of its functionalities
lesson_learned.liked_most: The functionality and drag and drop capabilities
lesson_learned.disliked_most: The Academy training
lesson_learned.advice: Just dive in

additional_context.deployment_scale: Don't know

lesson_learned.headline: Able to create professional looking applications quickly and with relative ease
lesson_learned.summary: When I first joined  I had little knowledge of Mendix but due to its wonderful tutorials and easy to use modeler I found myself making apps in no time. As part of my role I am required to take business requirements and implement them into an app. Mendix facilitates this very well. They are also very quick to respond to issues and queries that I, or my team, have.
lesson_learned.liked_most: Ability to quickly create and deploy apps
lesson_learned.disliked_most: No dark theme on the modeler
lesson_learned.advice: Use Mendix to facilitate an agile work environment

additional_context.deployment_scale: Departmental

lesson_learned.headline: Development is easy, but maintaining architecture is hard.
lesson_learned.summary: Excellent development velocity. However, it is very easy to develop application without any forethought. The platform lacks concepts available in other mainstream technologies, to enforce software (model) architecture. As the result, good architecture is product of experience and discipline. Given the lack of experienced Mendix developers, my experience is that it is harder than necessary to maintain architecture on Mendix platform. Consequences thereof include: higher maintenance costs, reduced scalability, etc.
lesson_learned.liked_most: Ease of development and deployment. Short time from building something and seeing it live.
lesson_learned.disliked_most:
No tools for controlling access to data and logic in modeller. It is very easy to access anything in model, even if those documents are not supposed to be used. It is very easy to change modules that should never be modified.

Merge functionality needs update:
- as-is: textual descriptions. wanted: visual dif
- too many changes that have no meaning (e.g. automatic name refactoring, canvas coordinate changes of multiple actions, when user inserts a new action). These changes that have no execution semantics, obscure real changes that are created by developers , thus making peer review harder than needed.
- revision details provide only a list of changed documents. I wish changes within those documents where also available.
lesson_learned.advice: Do not treat Mendix projects as if they do not require technical expertise. Doing so leads fast to creating a technical debt. A paradox: the platform often used to get rid of legacy applications may produce (in naive hands) applications that rather quickly become legacy themselves.

additional_context.deployment_scale: Organization-wide

lesson_learned.headline: Mendix helps me avoiding interpretation errors because i can build my own designs.
lesson_learned.summary: Mendix development realy speeds up my work as a Business Analyst. In the past is was used to write designs for software developers. Mendix gives me the opportunity to implement my designs in software myself.
lesson_learned.liked_most: Mendix enables creating professional web applications with a very small team of experts. This is possible because of a very good development environment, combined with easy deployment.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: when an upgrade of the product containts previously repaired bugs
lesson_learned.advice: lowcode means developers can work fast, it does nog mean you don't need technically skilled personel

additional_context.deployment_scale: Company-wide

lesson_learned.headline: exxxtreme fast programming suite for mainly front-end and process applications
lesson_learned.summary:
Mendix is fast and dynamic . 
The platform keeps evolving in monthly improvements of the modeler.
It integrates very smooth both rest Soap and other services.
It supports future way of software development, e.g. sprinter and real time collaboration. 
Besides new apps also 'older'existing MendixV1 (dated 2010) application are relatively easy to migrate towards current version 7 .
lesson_learned.liked_most:
Ease of implementation.
New features in modeler.
Understanding while building and communicate/interact with business and developer
lesson_learned.disliked_most:
it is still software, so architecture and business involvement is important.
also it is so fast that sometime the do before think mentality bits you in the back.
lesson_learned.advice:
use a good partner, have a architecture roadmap/vision.
fail fast !

integration_deployment.implementation_strategy: Worked with both the vendor and 3rd-party service providers

additional_context.deployment_scale: Organization-wide

lesson_learned.headline: Starting the digital transformation with Mendix
lesson_learned.summary: Our business was extremely please by seeing the results of working with Mendix, especially on the reduced timespan of building an application.
lesson_learned.liked_most: Flexibility in terms of customization (both front- and backend), and overall ease of use.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Building heavy applications can have an impact on performance. Some features with regards to health monitoring are not yet very mature (i believe they are being worked on). Offline capabilities were limited, but will improve with the introduction of nanoflows. We had some issues with responsiveness in the past, but these seem to have solved. Also i expect with the introduction of React Native, and the introduction of native apps, a lot of these issues will improve.
lesson_learned.advice: Start with small use cases (preferably low-complexity, high benefits type projects), but always keep the end-goal in mind. This way, if an early MVP proves to be succesful, you can build on your MVP and know it will be stable and robust when you start scaling or expanding functionality. Otherwise you risk having to rebuild your entire MVP, which can cause disappointment with the business and can mean extra costs and development times.

additional_context.deployment_scale: Specific divisions, regions, or business units

lesson_learned.headline: Mendix, an easy to learn platform.
lesson_learned.summary: Mendix is an easy to learn platform that lets you quickly create apps. It is easy to understand for business and developers and therefor makes it easy to collaborate between business units. Mendix is also constantly innovating which makes it relevant through time. As a developer I am motivated to improve my skills and help businesses.
lesson_learned.liked_most: That is it easy to implement and to learn. It is quick and easy to understand for both business and IT.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: That you have to update the modeler and keep your app updated.
lesson_learned.advice: Start with a small app and have a good idea of what you want in the app.

additional_context.deployment_scale: Organization-wide

lesson_learned.headline: GOOD
lesson_learned.summary: It was amazing experince as it was fisrt time i try to creaty my app, sure will explore more to create useful apps
lesson_learned.liked_most: Ease of Use
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Nothing

additional_context.deployment_scale: Team/ Individual

lesson_learned.headline: Rapid development, Large support community, Robust UI/UX control, hybrid mobile apps
lesson_learned.summary: I have been working with Mendix for many years. The platform provides a unique ability to develop apps rapidly from the ground up with little coding involved. Ideas can be turned into working programs in hours or weeks. The quality of tools and support provided by Mendix has grown over the years (along with the community). There are now an abundance of technical docs, an ever growing forum community, and a robust collection of learning resources and expert webinars available online. The employers I worked with ranged from having no in-house IT experience (all contracted out) to having an in-house software development team of about 20 people. In ever instance, Mendix served a purpose for the employer. On one hand it allowed quicker turnaround of features than allowed by the traditional team, and on the other hand it allowed for in-house software development capability with relatively low cost. Mendix will generally have a purpose based on your organization's needs.
lesson_learned.liked_most: Ease of use.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Many years ago, it was the availability of documentation and online resources. Since then the community has grown and the availability of documentation and learning resources has also grown tremendously.
lesson_learned.advice: Adopt Mendix fully and use it as a tool to solve problems. When learning, learn Mendix as a pure form with a diverse group of folks (diverse in software development experience).

additional_context.deployment_scale: Organization-wide

lesson_learned.headline: A quite extensive software building platform, which also accepts ideas for improvement
lesson_learned.summary: It's quite easy to learn though hard to master as they say. On the platform (website) there's an academy to teach basic skills in addition to the courses the company provides. The modeler itself is constantly being updated, which is handy for it's new functions, though you might run into conflicts if you update your project without thinking. Logic is easy to apply in your project as well as validation and custom error messages.
lesson_learned.liked_most: The modeler itself is free and you can build your own apps (though with limited users and limited space) also for free. This makes it easy to try out and learn it without being shackled to it immediately. When you decide to implement professional apps the mendix platform makes it very easy to deploy in a cloud environment. Building in the modeler itself is quite intuitive as well once you gather a bit more experience.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: The documentation on functions of the platform has quite restricted search words, making some information hard to find. For example: xpath function reversed() can be found when you know it is used for selfreference, but not by simply looking for reversed in documentation.
lesson_learned.advice: First try out the free modeler using the online academy, which will give you an idea of the speed of application building.

lesson_learned.disliked_most: None

additional_context.deployment_scale: Specific divisions, regions, or business units

lesson_learned.headline: Mendix Review
lesson_learned.summary: Overall, Mendix is quite a remarkable platform. It has made huge improvements since I began working with it in 2013. They continually enhance the product with new features that enable faster builds and deployments all while improving the UI/X experience for the end users. Will continue to work with Mendix for many years to come!
lesson_learned.liked_most: The speed in which we can build and deploy. We are often waiting on the Business rather than the Business waiting on us to build.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: The learning curve for new developers can be difficult.
lesson_learned.advice: Continue to enhance and improve the training, webinairs, and documentation!

additional_context.deployment_scale: Organization-wide

lesson_learned.headline: Great platform to build apps for my orginisation
lesson_learned.summary: Platform where you can quickly build apps. Very broad standard features and you can do everything yourself in the Mendix cloud.
lesson_learned.liked_most: The total integration from development to deployment and maintaince in one cloud environment. That is what it makes it very easy and quick to develop apps.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Sometimes sprintr is down
lesson_learned.advice: Just use it!

additional_context.deployment_scale: Team/ Individual

lesson_learned.headline: Complete solution for ideation and experimenting with new business models
lesson_learned.summary: The whole platform is pretty much complete. It gives you lots of possibilities to develop apps without coding for different device simultaneously. Very useful for ideation and experimenting with new business models to engage with customers. Very easy to implement and deploy apps in cloud.
lesson_learned.liked_most: Does not require programming experienced people to work with platform.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Limitations of native mobile apps.
lesson_learned.advice: Think of the people who will be using the platform as it is not designed for no low-code developers.

lesson_learned.headline: Great tool for quickly developing applications
lesson_learned.summary: I have thoroughly enjoyed using Mendix as a development tool. Have made great improvements on the web based tutorials and has an active community.
lesson_learned.liked_most: Ease of use. After learning the basics of how Mendix works I was able to implement many features quickly. Support has been great. Very knowledgeable experts that want to make sure that you succeed. Constantly looking forward.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Nothing major.
lesson_learned.advice: Engage in communication with current/former customers about their experience with the Mendix team. Dont be afraid to ask the community they are more than willing to help.

lesson_learned.headline: Quick and easy implementation that meets the business's needs
lesson_learned.liked_most: The intuitiveness of the client and the transparency of processes makes the modeler ideal for both simple and complicated projects.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Limited styling options within the modeler itself - additional software is required for proper styling management.

lesson_learned.headline: Software is nice to work with from a beginner point of view to an expert level

Start making custom elements as soon as possible so also the front-end is modular like the rest of the software.
This way you have your own company feeling build in a rapid product tool!

lesson_learned.headline: Great tool for both the novice and experienced developer
lesson_learned.liked_most: The easiness of use.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Error handling. But that's never fun ;)

lesson_learned.headline: With Mendix I've switched gears for my IT capabilities
lesson_learned.liked_most:
High speed of delivery.
Steep learning curve.
Small teams, great value.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: One might consider the vendor lockin an issue. For shortlived customer facing apps, I don't see the big issue. For enterprise wide, core application servies it requires some strategic planning.
lesson_learned.advice: Give it a try on a non critical project. You'll be amazed how fast you can be really productive. And even if dissatisfied...you'll throwaway not more then a few days of work.

lesson_learned.headline: New way of software development.
lesson_learned.summary: It brought me a life as a new way of software development. I have been strongly recommending to my colleagues.
lesson_learned.liked_most: Data modeling and UI implementation.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Nothing so far.
lesson_learned.advice: It is the best prototyping tool I've experienced.

lesson_learned.headline: Great platform to create your business applications.
lesson_learned.liked_most: The visual way of programming.
lesson_learned.advice: In order to get the full advantage of Mendix, you need some experience in your organisation. Internally or externally.

lesson_learned.headline: Steep learning curve, but plentiful support resources.
lesson_learned.liked_most: Their ability to continue to expand and adapt to the needs and wants of end-users.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: The fact that upgrading is risky - some deep functionalities can be severely impacted by upgrading - while others can only be saved by upgrading.
lesson_learned.advice: Realize the amount of resources available for this platform in terms of knowledge - if you have an issue or a question; there is a very reasonable chance that someone else has - and has possibly found the answer in a user forum.

lesson_learned.headline: Easy and fun to use.
lesson_learned.liked_most: I have a great understanding of how the pieces and parts work together and I can quickly create and adjust microflows/pages on the fly based on customer needs.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: There are some small quirks that occasionally make development inconvenient and you will have to get creative to solve a problem.
lesson_learned.advice: Don't be afraid to get your hands dirty. It's the best way to learn. Get in there an make mistakes.

lesson_learned.headline: Modern and smooth modeller to implement quickly and rock-solid
lesson_learned.liked_most: Modern, easy to learn
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Webmodeller.
lesson_learned.advice: Start, try and see the results.

lesson_learned.headline: Very shallow learning curve got experienced and novice developers working immediately
lesson_learned.liked_most: The speed at which we can deliver solutions.
lesson_learned.disliked_most:
Merging conflicting changes delivered by different developers requires a more hands-on approach than traditional development. The merge tool is all-or-nothing so it requires the team to spend a little more time when conflicts arise. 
Coming from a traditional development background, I've found myself stuck a few times on features Mendix does not support and therefore required a work-around or time spent developing a custom widget.
lesson_learned.advice: Make sure you spend time early in your project understanding the architecture of your potential solution and how it fits in Mendix's set of tools.

lesson_learned.headline: Great platform with some learning curve.
lesson_learned.liked_most: Flexibility. While many low code platforms are limited in exactly what you can do in the box, Mendix leverages java and javascript widgeting and a widget store to extend it's functionality and empower developers.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Domain model organization can be a pain. Many aspects of the application can be customized and organized but the domain model view can become incredibly cumbersome to navigate, specially for a model first framework.
lesson_learned.advice: Have your developers get very comfortable with the IDE. The tutorial is a great introduction but actually developing some POCs to get your feet wet is a must before starting any estimates.

lesson_learned.headline: They put their money where their mouth is; quick development with a solid tool!
lesson_learned.liked_most: The visual way in which the app can be constructed.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Nothing
lesson_learned.advice: Nothing yet.

lesson_learned.liked_most: Quick development. Fail fast learn fast
lesson_learned.disliked_most: N/A
lesson_learned.advice: Mendix is a good tool when used correctly.

lesson_learned.headline: Speed up your development but also keep in mind what you want to create
Applications built and ready for Corporate Companies
lesson_learned.liked_most: user friendliness and the package as a whole in one.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Deviation from programming. I guess its worth it when you see the end product.
lesson_learned.advice: This platform adopts all functions and services of traditional programming and development.

lesson_learned.headline: Mendix offers a lot out of the box and continues to grow, but clients always want custom
Fast Time To Market and Understandable by Most Users
lesson_learned.liked_most: Integrated Development Environment w/ easy path to production readiness.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Lack of database access in the cloud production environment.
lesson_learned.advice: Don't try to shove Mendix into your existing development systems and methodologies.

lesson_learned.headline: Lots of function.  Still learning how to best implement and communicate to stakeholders
lesson_learned.liked_most: I like that there is a lot of support online and its easy to see your changes.  Version control is also nice for when working on a team.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Some functions are not intuitive to people without a development background.  Don't have any suggestion for this though.
lesson_learned.advice: If possible have a team structure to develop.  It helps when new members join to have internal support.

lesson_learned.headline: Ease of development / reduced time to market gets complex with scale
lesson_learned.liked_most: Excellent customer support
lesson_learned.disliked_most: None
lesson_learned.advice: Architecture and components are paramount. It is easier to build but might become a challenge with scale.

lesson_learned.headline: Implementation has been easy. But will need to see what our maintenance path would be.
lesson_learned.liked_most: Faster development and quick feedback loops
lesson_learned.advice: Medix is a great tool if you are going to go to market faster in some of the usecases

lesson_learned.headline: Very easy to use through the development life cycle.
lesson_learned.liked_most: Easy to use
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Could be slow
lesson_learned.advice: Get all stakeholders involved from the very beginning otherwise your product will not be fit for purpose.

lesson_learned.headline: Mendix is awesome!
Easy to learn, active community
lesson_learned.advice: Build apps using the agile framework but keep in mind best practices so that queries are speedy/efficient.

lesson_learned.headline: Great developer productivity and quick to market
lesson_learned.liked_most: Developer productivity

Easy to use

lesson_learned.headline: Mendix is easy to understand but complex to apply well. It's interesting to learn it.

lesson_learned.advice: What is the purpose and requirements of your solution

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: Mendix: a strategic partner that supports beyond the platform
lesson_learned.liked_most: Mendix allows businesses to build sophiscated proof of concept applications in a few days - turning ideas into applications.  The Mendix platform allows the creation of data models and screen designs to be achieved very quickly.  Further, user story management, burn-down charts, application feedback features, environment and performance monitoring tools are all built into the Mendix platform.  You don't need to select individual tools and get them working before you can start development.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: When you purchase a bundle of application licences these are all based on the same size of application container (with a specific amount of RAM, amount of storage, and number of process cores).  It can expensive if the business requires a small mobile application and all you have is large containers, as such a container is oversized for the application requirement.  You can purchase individual licences but this can be expensive.  The cost of entry for Mendix applications is still cheap but having the same container for a light-weight mobile application and a 10,000 user customer facing portal can be difficult to sell to the business.
lesson_learned.advice: Recognise that introducing a low-code RAD platform such as Mendix will challenge the way your team, technology department and business works - it's not just a technology platform.  From infrastructrure, governance, project methodology, skill sets, business engagement, scaling, service delivery and security - you will need to be prepared to build confidence within the business by demonstrating compentence.  I would recommend you get support in understanding and overcoming the challenges.

lesson_learned.headline: A great vendor delivering an essential part of any IT toolkit
lesson_learned.liked_most: It does what it should. Fast development, ridiculously fast changes. The deployment / devops are great. Migrating test>UAT>Prod is controlled and a breeze. Source code management is built right into the product. The product's ability to ensure compliance with security, prevent errors, and integrate with Web Services easily are really valued. There is tremendous flexibility on UX allowing us to complete a formal UX design process without worrying about product constraints. Releases are also frequent (monthly) and each release adds something of real value. Importantly, it's really fast.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: The product is very object / entity driven. There are some circumstances where one needs to create an entity to pass something where you could have just passed an attribute of another entity; however these situations are manageable. The built-in agile story management is just OK and I would prefer if Mendix integrated with Jira or Pivotal. There are small situations where the model makes you wish for something different but the solution is more commonly to shift your old preconceptions of how apps are developed. Improvements occur regularly through ongoing releases.
lesson_learned.advice: Start small so that you get to production as quickly as possible and control your Minimum Viable Project tightly to ensure that you don't let "perfect" get in the way of "good".

lesson_learned.headline: User friendly and fast platform.
lesson_learned.liked_most: User friendly, fast and good status overview of actions
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Nothing.
lesson_learned.advice: Understand basics of Agile SCRUM

lesson_learned.headline: Design Thinking made easy!
lesson_learned.advice: Start small and carry out pilot implementation.

lesson_learned.headline: Mendix Advanced Training Product review
lesson_learned.liked_most: I do like the quick development. The easy layout provided out of the box.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: There are certain nuances, such as level of embefded Data Views that are allowed, and things along that nature that are not intuitive and make certain development aspects harder. Not sure if it is due to lack of following best practices or not. I dislike how hidden some of the CSS classes are and how it can be very challenging to find out how certain items are layed out on the page and what is affecting the layouts.
lesson_learned.advice:
Take the time to ensure proper permission and security declaration prior to deployment. It will make life easier 
 instead of deciding to put it off until the end, at which point it can become overwhelming.

lesson_learned.headline: Implementation was simple and the software was developed with very few issues
lesson_learned.liked_most: Ease / Speed of implementing new applications
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Mendix's estimate for helping us deploy our 2nd application was not cost effective and we were directed to a partner (this implied to us that mendix really doesn't want to be in the development / professional services business for a customer the size of our company).  working cost effectively with mendix resources was one of the reasons we selected the platform
lesson_learned.advice: Understand the BUSINESS REQUIREMENTS as fully as possible to try and avoid re-designs that may be required otherwise

lesson_learned.headline: Mendix fills a gap in our technology resources, and has continued to please end-users
lesson_learned.liked_most: It delivers what we need most.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Needs better integration options with other platforms.
lesson_learned.advice:
Learn the Mendix best practices before diving in.

Choose a vendor with proven mendix track record, not just one who offers services.
